bug.short_desc: In "ru" layout AltGr key is unconditionally mapped to Level3 modifier
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: In iersion 2.18 of xkeyboard-config Ruble symbol was added to "ru" layout, unconditionally setting AltGr to Level3 modifier[1]. This breaks any other use of AltGr, like grp:switch and there's no way to turn it off besides editing /usr/share/X11/xkb/symbols/ru file. Since lv3:* options exists, it was later fixed in upstream[2], fix was included in version 2.19.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): xkeyboard-config-2.18-1.fc25.noarch
How reproducible: Always.
Steps to Reproduce: 1. setxkbmap -layout us,ru -option '' -option grp:switch,grp:shift_caps_toggle
Actual results: AltGr does not switch keyboard layout when pressed in "ru" layout.
Expected results: AltGr should switch keyboard layout in any layout.
Additional info: [1]. https://cgit.freedesktop.org/xkeyboard-config/commit/?id=85845be3a51f1ae790902b2b4c837d11382f50d8 [2]. https://cgit.freedesktop.org/xkeyboard-config/commit/?id=bf0263d2f8e7e0ff0135c47f9b7213931345fa94
